message_1: Find the smallest positive integer x such that $7^{x} \equiv 5 \pmod{11}$.
message_2:
We will use the method of repeated squaring to find the smallest positive integer x such that $7^{x} \equiv 5 \pmod{11}$.

First, we find the powers of 7 modulo 11:
$7^1 \equiv 7 \pmod{11}$
$7^2 \equiv 7 \cdot 7 \equiv 49 \equiv 5 \pmod{11}$

We see that $7^2 \equiv 5 \pmod{11}$. Therefore, the smallest positive integer x is $\boxed{2}$.
